title: India to buy defence, agriculture goods, aircraft from US: Officials reveal key details of trade deal
content: India and the US have struck a significant trade deal, with New Delhi committing to purchase over $500 billion in American products across sectors like agriculture, defense, and petroleum. This agreement aims to lower tariffs and boost US agricultural exports to India, potentially impacting rural economies. President Trump also linked the pact to energy policy and global peace efforts.

title: Lower than Pakistan, China: How trade deal with US gives India its edge back
content: With this deal, India bags a place among countries facing one of the lowest tariff rates from the Donald Trump administration. Incidentally, the 18% tariff rate is lower than Pakistan’s 19%, Indonesia’s 19%.

title: ‘No big deal’: Manjrekar says India's wins over Pak now feel like beating 'minnows'
content: Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar believes the potential India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match cancellation is insignificant, stating the rivalry has lost its competitive edge. He argues India now dominates, making encounters feel one-sided, unlike past contests. Manjrekar asserts the tournament's value remains unaffected by this fixture's absence.

title: Oracle makes a public clarification on the deal that could end up in 30,000 job cuts
content: Oracle is defending its substantial AI partnership with OpenAI amidst reports of potential job cuts to fund infrastructure. Despite a stalled Nvidia deal, Oracle remains confident in OpenAI's funding capabilities. However, the company's massive debt and market cap decline raise investor concerns about its ambitious AI spending plans.

title: 5 dead as bus carrying 30 passengers falls into gorge in Dehradun
content: A heartbreaking incident unfolded in the Kalsi region of Dehradun Tuesday morning, where a Himachal Roadways bus veered off the road and plunged into a treacherous gorge along Meenak Road. With over 30 souls aboard, at least five sadly lost their lives.

title: 2 British tourists served ‘leave India’ notice over pro-Palestine stickers
content: Two British tourists were issued a 'leave India' notice by Rajasthan CID for posting stickers advocating for Palestine and opposing Israel in Pushkar. The authorities deemed the act a violation of visa regulations and local sensitivities, leading to their immediate departure mandate. All stickers have since been removed.

title: 'Dhurandhar 2 The Revenge' teaser: Ranveer Singh’s menacing avatar dominates Lyari town
content: Get ready for an adrenaline-pumping ride as Ranveer Singh reprises his role as the enigmatic spy Hamza Ali Mazar in 'Dhurandhar 2: The Revenge', set to hit cinemas on March 19, 2026. The recently unveiled teaser and ominous poster tease his ascension within the feared Dakait group. Read on to know more.

title: 'Not just you, we too are not happy with your ... ': Sam Altman slams Nvidia CEO
content: Despite public assurances, reports indicate friction between OpenAI and Nvidia. OpenAI is reportedly seeking alternative AI chips due to dissatisfaction with Nvidia's current offerings for inference tasks, a crucial area for AI model responses. This search for new hardware comes as the two tech giants are reportedly in investment talks.

title: Delhi school fee law deferred: Why the new rules won’t apply in 2025–26
content: Delhi’s new school fee regulation law has not been struck down, but it has been rescheduled. After the Supreme Court flagged the haste of enforcing a committee-driven regime mid-academic year, the Delhi government told the court it would not implement the law in 2025–26. A Gazette notification now resets timelines, caps interim fees, and prepares the ground for full rollout from 2026–27.

title: Form vs faith: Samson’s slide opens door as Kishan storms into India’s T20 WC plans
content: India's T20 juggernaut faces a crucial selection dilemma ahead of the 2026 World Cup, with Sanju Samson's recent form under scrutiny. Despite a strong past record, his struggles against New Zealand have opened the door for Ishan Kishan's impressive resurgence, creating a headache for the management as they aim to defend their title.

title: India-US trade deal: Top stocks that will benefit from reduced tariffs
content: According to MOFSL, this is a high-impact development and will have a multi-layered positive effect on the Indian economy, prevailing market sentiments, and sectors exporting to the US, which will benefit from better competitiveness. Key sectoral beneficiaries include Auto Ancillaries, Defence, Consumer, Textiles, EMS, Consumer Durables, IT Services, Financials (second-order beneficiary), and Utility companies.

title: Apple’s first foldable iPhone design leaked online: Here’s what the smartphone may offer
content: Apple's first foldable iPhone, rumored for a late 2024 launch, is reportedly adopting a book-fold design akin to Samsung's Galaxy Z Fold. Leaks suggest a 7.8-inch main display, a 5.3-inch cover screen, and a surprising return of Touch ID. The device is expected to feature dual 48MP rear cameras and a titanium-aluminum build.

title: Uttarakhand man who shielded Muslim trader becomes social media star
content: Deepak Kumar, who intervened to protect a Muslim shopkeeper from Bajrang Dal members, has gained significant online fame. Despite facing FIRs for assault and intimidation, Kumar remains resolute, stating he would defend humanity again. The incident has drawn national attention and sparked a debate on religious tolerance and vigilantism.

title: Mercedes goes berserk in Mumbai: Minor driver’s 2am crash leaves wrecked cars in Coastal Road tunnel
content: In a troubling incident on the coastal road tunnel, a 75-year-old patriarch, alongside his young granddaughter and her friend, are entangled in legal issues. The minor, behind the wheel of the family’s high-end vehicle, crashed into another car early Sunday morning, resulting in one reported injury.

title: ‘Well played’: US Senator wanting 500% tariff for Russian oil says India ‘earned’ reduction
content: US President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with India in which the US will bring down tariffs on Indian exports to 18%. Trump also made a series of claims related to the trade deal such as India agreeing to stop buying Russian crude

title: Uproar in Rajya Sabha as MP C Sadanandan displays artificial limbs
content: In a powerful moment during his inaugural address in the Rajya Sabha, a BJP politician unveiled his prosthetic limbs, recounting a violent incident from 31 years ago involving CPM activists. His intent was to illustrate the meaning of democracy to the populace, igniting a heated debate with CPM representatives over the theme of political brutality.

title: No boycott call for women as Pakistan set to face India despite men's T20 WC standoff
content: Despite Pakistan's men's team boycotting their T20 World Cup match against India, the women's A team is set to play their Indian counterparts in the Rising Stars Asia Cup. Preparations are on track for the February 15th fixture, highlighting a stark contrast in the handling of the women's game amidst the ongoing controversy.

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan receives Vatican invitation to meet Pope Leo XIV in March
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has received an invitation from the Vatican to meet Pope Leo XIV in March, following a state government request. A 16-member delegation, including special representative K V Thomas, was approved for the March 4 audience. However, a final decision on the visit is pending due to the upcoming assembly election dates.

title: Man moves back to India after 7 successful years in US, compares with life in Bengaluru
content: Many professionals are facing tough decisions whether to return to India after spending years in the US, finding the reality of daily life less ideological and more practical than online narratives suggested. While acknowledging genuine challenges like pollution and bureaucracy, he also noted similar issues abroad and found unexpected conveniences, leading him to not regret his decision.

title: Parents of students chasing degrees abroad get breather
content: The Union Budget has reduced the Tax Collected at Source (TCS) on overseas education and medical remittances from 5% to 2% under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS). This move is expected to provide immediate financial relief to Indian families supporting students abroad, easing their upfront cash burden amidst rising international education costs.

title: Cong fires 4 questions on India-US trade deal; asks what happened to 'Make In India'
content: The Congress party has urged the Central government to disclose the full details of the India-US trade agreement, questioning its impact on farmers, industry, and the "Make in India" initiative. Concerns were raised over India reportedly agreeing to zero tariffs on US goods and potentially halting Russian oil purchases.

title: Trump’s surprise announcement: How US blinked and said yes to trade deal with India
content: The recently concluded India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) talks put pressure on the Donald Trump administration. In fact both India and the EU have termed the FTA a ‘mother of all trade deals’.

title: Where are gold, silver prices headed after worst decline since 1980?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may continue to be under pressure in the near term and high volatility is expected in silver prices, says Praveen Singh, Senior Fundamental Research Analyst- Currencies and Commodities at Mirae Asset Sharekhan. Here’s his outlook on gold prices:

title: Father of 3 kills daughter to meet 2-child Maha poll norm
content: A Maharashtra man, Pandurang Kondamangale, has been arrested for allegedly drowning his six-year-old daughter to become eligible for local elections.  Maharashtra law bars candidates with more than two children.  The village sarpanch, Ganesh Shinde, is also held for aiding the plot.  The crime surfaced after the girl's body was found in a canal.

title: At 90, Dalai Lama gets Grammy for audiobook ‘Meditations’
content: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA), which is headquartered at McLeod Ganj in Dharamshala, said the award is a profound honour for Tibetan society. Although the Grammy spread cheer in this hill town, celebrations are on hold as the Dalai Lama is in Karnataka. American singer-songwriter Rufus Wainwright received the award on his behalf.

title: Two fidayeen women led attacks through Balochistan targeting govt offices, banks
content: The wave of attacks saw around a dozen participants ranging from 60-year-old Hatam Naz Sumalani to 70-year-old Nako Fazal Baloch who blew themselves up at different locations during the violence. But by trading classrooms and social media feeds for the frontlines, Mengal and Baloch have signalled a deepening crisis within the province.

title: India-US trade deal impact: Sensex surges over 2,300 points; Nifty50 up over 2%
content: Stock market today LIVE after India-US trade deal: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex soared in opening trade on Tuesday, reacting positively to the India-US trade deal announcement by US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Dhurandhar 2: Ranveer looks ruthless in bloodied avatar as makers drop menacing poster
content: As anticipation builds for the 'Dhurandhar 2' teaser, the creators have dropped an electrifying poster showcasing Ranveer Singh in a chilling, blood-spattered look, teasing a storyline packed with intensity. This sequel to the blockbuster that grossed Rs 1300 crore is set to enthrall audiences with even more heart-pounding action and deep intrigue.

title: Diaspora’s dream close as 40 Indian-origin players set to spice up T20 WC
content: Dozens of players with Indian roots are representing other nations at the T20 World Cup, chasing dreams they couldn't fulfill in India's competitive cricket scene. From the US to Canada, Oman, and the UAE, these cricketers, including former age-group players and even professionals, are seizing second chances on the international stage, cherishing every moment.

title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Clippers? Latest 76ers injury update
content: Joel Embiid is probable for the Philadelphia 76ers' February 2, 2026, game against the Los Angeles Clippers due to right ankle management.  The team is cautiously handling his workload, prioritizing postseason health.  Despite past absences, Embiid has performed well when available, and his presence is crucial for the Sixers' playoff aspirations.

title: Squash: Anahat Singh beats world No. 10 to win title, becomes youngest Asian in top-20
content: Seventeen-year-old Anahat Singh achieved a career-defining victory at the Squash On Fire Open, defeating top seed Georgina Kennedy in the final. This PSA Bronze-level title marks her 15th overall and makes her the youngest Asian player to enter the world's top 20.

title: Fasting Sugar Vs HbA1c Confusion: Expert explains why test results differ
content: Diabetes diagnosis can be tricky. A fasting blood sugar test might seem normal, but your HbA1c could be high. This happens because HbA1c reflects average sugar over months, catching hidden spikes. Lifestyle changes like diet and exercise can help lower these levels. Understanding these tests is key for better health management.

title: Noida techies defend flying kiss gesture after viral video, claim it was for child in car
content: Two software engineers were apprehended in Noida for allegedly harassing a woman and her family by following their car and making lewd gestures. The incident, captured on video by the victim, led to the swift arrest of the accused after police traced their vehicle. Both men confessed to being intoxicated at the time of the offense.

title: US confirms removal of 25% penal tariffs on India, but there’s a catch
content: Donald Trump has claimed that the trade deal has been agreed after India has agreed to reduce tariffs on US goods to zero, committed to stop buying Russian crude and step up oil purchases from America, and potentially Venezuela.

title: Ann Michael turns heads in bold Super Bowl workout look as Drake Maye preps
content: Ann Michael Maye kicked off Super Bowl 2026 week with a viral workout post as the Patriots prepare to face the Seahawks. From supporting Drake Maye at key playoff moments to launching her NBC Sports Boston show, Ann’s rise mirrors New England’s return to the sport’s biggest stage.

title: Manipur Government formation: What led to President’s rule in the strife-hit State? The story so far
content: With President’s Rule set to end soon, discussions are underway to form a new government as tensions remain high in the region.

title: Sabarimala gold row: LDF in Kerala questions Sonia Gandhi link to put Congress on the defensive
content: Kerala Law Minister Rajeeve says Congress is ‘still at a loss to coherently explain’ the presence of two main suspects in the case at residence of Sonia Gandhi in Delhi

title: Veteran music director S. P. Venkatesh dies at 70
content: The acclaimed composer, known for his evocative scores and popular songs of the 1980s and 1990s, passed away in Chennai, leaving behind a defining Malayalam film legacy.

title: Stern action will be initiated if anyone violates Section-30: Parvatipuram SP Madhav Reddy
content: Madhav Reddy said the rule was imposed against the backdrop of agitations and protests which led to violence at other places in Andhra Pradesh

title: NDA should not be complacent with wins in various elections: PM Modi
content: At the NDA Parliamentary Party meeting, the prime minister was felicitated for successfully concluding trade deals with 39 countries

title: Chennai triple murder of migrant family: Tamil Nadu government to facilitate shifting of bodies to Bihar
content: On reports that assistance was required to move the bodies of the three deceased to their native State, Chief Minister Stalin instructed authorities to facilitate it free of cost

title: Rename Ladki Bahin scheme after Ajit Pawar: NCP leader
content: The Ladki Bahin scheme was announced by Ajit Pawar when he was the Finance Minister and started in July 2024

title: Climate report: Warming trend persists in Kerala despite slight relief in 2025
content: According to Statement on Climate for the State of Kerala: 2025, temperatures remained higher than normal, though the year was significantly cooler than 2024 – the warmest year on record for Kerala since observations began in 1901

title: Air India starts inspection of fuel control switches in its Boeing 787 planes
content: An Air India pilot on February 2 reported a defect with the fuel control switch of a Boeing 787-8 plane after operating the flight from London Heathrow to Bengaluru

title: Delegation demands proper maintenance of R.N. Shetty stadium in Dharwad
content: Among other things, the lone toilet and two urinals in the sports complex are in poor condition, and unfit for use

title: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu to visit Kurnool district on February 7
content: The Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh will also inspect the agricultural lands of the farmers on the occasion

title: NIA raids suspect's house in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar
content: The searches by the agency were carried out at a residential house in Hazari Bazar locality in the early hours

title: Budget announcement on Harappan site in Haryana’s Rakhigarhi met with scepticism
content: A similar announcement was made in the Union Budget 2020-21, but little progress was made at the site.

title: Supreme Court slams WhatsApp, Meta over ‘take it or leave it’ privacy policy, says will pass interim order on February 9
content: “You can’t play with the right of privacy of this country in the name of data sharing,” Supreme Court tells WhatsApp and Meta

title: Rahul Gandhi-Om Birla face off: Rule 349 silent on published or unpublished texts, says expert
content: The Lok Sabha saw a stand off between Speaker Om Birla and Rahul Gandhi when the Speaker disallowed the LoP to quote from the unpublished memoir of the former Army chief Naravane

title: Chief Superintendent of Kalaburagi Central Prison transferred amid inquiry
content: Kalaburagi Central Prison had been in the news following clashes among inmates, allegations of bribery against prison officials, and reports of prisoners being provided expensive liquor and cigarettes

title: Congress asks Govt. to take Parliament into confidence on U.S., EU trade deals
content: In a post on X, the Congress hit out at the government and said India has the right to know details of the trade deal

title: Arms, explosives seized; militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces also “safely disposed of” 18 IEDs at the spot after recovery, the police said in a statement

title: South Korea’s tech support to help small farmers in Punjab: CM Bhagwant Mann
content: South Korea’s vertical farming technology for small agricultural holdings can prove extremely useful for Punjab, says Punjab Chief Minister

title: ED raids multiple locations in Bengal, Delhi in sand, coal smuggling probe
content: The latest raids target key individuals and properties linked to the alleged illicit coal trade, signaling a broader crackdown on corruption in West Bengal’s mining sector

title: Father hacks daughter to death in Kerala’s Manjeswaram over property dispute; relative injured in attack dies later
content: According to the police, Umar Farooq first stabbed Sheikh Abba during the argument, leaving him grievously injured. He then allegedly attacked his sister-in-law with a machete.

title: Stock markets cheer India-U.S. trade deal: Sensex jumps over 5%; Nifty nears all-time high
content: India and the U.S. have agreed to a trade deal under which Washington will bring down the reciprocal tariff on Indian goods to 18% from the current 25%

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 5 LIVE: Both Houses resume; Govt. will provide details of India-U.S. trade deal today, Nadda says
content: Congress demanded that the Modi government take Parliament into confidence and that the texts of both the EU and U.S. trade deals be laid on the tables of both Houses and debated

title: Work on South Coast Railway Zone to begin soon: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Vijayawada Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) Mohit Sonakiya said the work on Errupalem-Nambur and Kotipalli-Narsapur lines were progressing.

title: Delhi government plans new bridge over Yamuna river to ease traffic congestion
content: The proposal was put forth by the Trans-Yamuna Board during a recent meeting with officials of the Public Works Department

title: Children’s festival held as part of Raichur Zilla Utsav 2026
content: Children Festival was held at the Mahatma Gandhi district stadium in Raichur on February 2 as part of Raichur Zilla Utsav 2026

title: Supreme Court bail to 3 accused in 2024 Pune Porsche crash: Victim's kin say it sends wrong message
content: The case relates to the incident on May 19, 2024, when a Porsche car allegedly driven by a 17-year-old boy under the influence of alcohol fatally knocked down two IT professionals in Pune's Kalyani Nagar area

title: Kochi airport to become India’s first airport to operate hydrogen-powered buses
content: Procurement and operation of three hydrogen fuel cell electric buses at Kochi airport is part of Kerala Hydrogen Valley initiative under National Green Hydrogen Mission of Government of India

title: India-U.S. deal: Five unanswered questions
content: U.S. President Trump and PM Modi announce U.S. tariff rates have been slashed to 18%, but questions over the broader FTA, Indian investment commitments, Russian oil, Chabahar port remain

title: What is the next phase for rural women entrepreneurship?
content: The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana National Rural Livelihoods Mission has been enhancing rural women’s entrepreneurship and political power in India by empowering over 10 crore households through self-help groups

title: Why are tribals protesting in Maharashtra? | Explained
content: Why did thousands of tribals hit the streets in the State? What are the reasons behind the protests? What are concerns about the implementation of the Forest Rights Act? Why are land rights, which are at the heart of the protest, a long-pending demand?

title: Union Ministers hail ‘historic’ India-U.S. trade deal; Congress says PM has ‘capitulated finally’
content: India and the U.S. agreed to a trade deal under which Washington will bring down the reciprocal tariff on Indian goods to 18% from the current 25%

title: Centre has taken note of water contamination incident in Indore, Minister informs Rajya Sabha
content: In a written reply to a question, Union Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Tokhan Sahu said that the area has old pipelines dating back to 1997, adding that “some of it is damaged, so the municipal administration identified the old stretches of pipeline and included them under AMRUT 2.0”

title: Madhya Pradesh cough syrup deaths: Four-year-old dies months after being in coma in AIIMS Nagpur
content: Betul Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr. Manoj Hurmade confirmed the child’s death and said the post-mortem examination was conducted in Nagpur, and the body was handed over to the family

title: ISRO tests thrust chamber for LOX-Methane Engine
content: The test was conducted at the Thrust Chamber Test facility at ISRO Propulsion Complex (IPRC), Mahendragiri on January 27, 2026

title: Survey in and around Kolkata shows most students in 17-24 age group read books only occasionally
content: According to the survey, conducted by the Kolkata-based Sabar Institute and the Sarojini Naidu College for Women, 35% of students in the age group 17-24 years read only occasionally while 25% sat with a book daily

title: Thirupparankundram ‘deepam’ row: Madurai Collector tenders unconditional apology to Madras High Court
content: Collector K.J. Praveen Kumar, in an affidavit, informed the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court that he had passed the prohibitory orders at Thirupparankundram on December 3, 2025, taking into account the ground situation and to maintain law and order.

title: Rajasthan fully prepared to take advantage of budgetary incentives: CM
content: “The Union Budget will give new strength to all-round development of Rajasthan and support our resolve to achieve the development goals… It is a roadmap for a developed India,” Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma said

title: SAD claims Majithia a victim of political vendetta, after he gets bail in DA case
content: Senior SAD leaders Daljit Singh Cheema and Arshdeep Singh Kler alleged the State government had concocted a false disproportionate assets case against Mr. Majithia

title: BJP names Tarun Chugh as observer for Legislature Party leader election in Manipur
content: MHA calls meeting with Kuki-Zo insurgent groups in indication that elected government could be restored in Manipur soon

title: Parliament security breach case: police oppose bail to 3
content: Terming the accused as “lead players” in the security breach of the Parliament, counsel representing the Delhi police said that pamphlets carried by the accused contained an “open threat” to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi and that they intended to “usurp power”

title: Coimbatore gang-rape case: Trial commences, counsel for three accused men appointed
content: As per the prosecution, the three men gang-raped the college student in a deserted area near Brindhavan Nagar, close to the Coimbatore airport, on the intervening night of November 2 and 3, 2025.

title: Tamil Biennale will be held in January 2027, Stalin says at Global Tourism Summit
content: State govt. signs 127 MoUs worth ₹22,794 crore, which are likely to create 65,937 jobs. Tourism infrastructure such as theme parks and camping sites will be set up at 31 locations, says CM

title: 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants deported and another 370 have been identified, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: Home Minister G. Parameshwara on Monday told the Legislative Assembly that 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants had been deported from Karnataka so far, while another 370 had been identified under the ongoing drive in this regard

title: Three booked on cheating charge
content: The Kothamangalam police registered a case against three people, including two local BJP leaders, for allegedly cheating a 58-year-old man of nearly ₹10 lakh

title: Kufos launches new initiative to conserve Kadamakudy
content: As the first phase of the initiative, Kufos will undertake a detailed local-level survey in Kadamakudy panchayat

title: National security on a slippery regional landscape
content: India’s national security will experience regional turbulence with minimal involvement in the larger international security landscape

title: Rise in southern States’ share in devolution of funds provides no relief to Tamil Nadu
content: The share of Tamil Nadu, which was 4.079% in the 15th FC, rose to 4.097% now, accounting for a rate of increase of only 0.44%; as part of horizontal devolution, the weights assigned to the criteria of area, demographic performance and per-capita GSDP (Gross State Domestic Product) have reduced affecting States like T.N and Kerala

title: A hat tip to Tamil Nadu’s industrial strength, reforms
content: The Economic Survey of India (2025-26) reinforces Tamil Nadu’s position as an investment-ready, industry-first State

title: Mob vandalises, torches homes in Chhattisgarh village as police shield minority residents against them
content: At least seven policemen suffered injuries while shielding over two dozen people, including women and children, against a mob of hundreds for several hours

title: Sarbananda Sonowal targets Congress for alleged corruption, scams
content: The Minister alleges prolonged neglect of the northeastern region by previous Congress governments, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi calls the region ‘Ashtalakshmi’

title: West Bengal Government questions maintainability of ED plea in Supreme Court on I-PAC case
content: The State asked whether the petition was maintainable when a similar case was pending before the Calcutta High Court urging identical grounds of challenge

title: NDA Parliamentary party meeting on February 3
content: MPs belonging to the BJP, TDP, JD(U), LJP (R), Shiv Sena, JD(S) and other constituents of the NDA will attend the meeting. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to address the lawmakers on a host of issues at the meeting, sources said

title: Rajasthan SIR: Bulk Form 7 applications for voter name deletion surface in Barmer; BJP BLAs deny filing them
content: Hundreds of Form 7 applications seeking deletion of voter names surface mysteriously in Rajasthan’s Chohtan Assembly constituency; booth-level agents of the BJP in whose names the forms had been filed say they have not signed them

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of ‘misleading’ the nation on 2017 Doklam issue
content: “Rahul Gandhi is not only wounding the dignity of Parliament through continuous false accusations and statements that spread confusion, but he is also hurting the morale of our valiant soldiers,” says BJP MP

title: 18% U.S. tariff on ‘Made in India’ products, says PM Modi after phone call with President Trump
content: Agreed to a trade deal between the United States and India, says U.S. President Trump; India will ‘buy much more from the United States and potentially, Venezuela’, he adds

title: Form 7 filings for deletion of names from electoral rolls spark outrage in Gujarat
content: Voters have claimed that their names, phone, and EPIC details were misused, and signatures forged to file false claims; Opposition parties blame the BJP, while the ruling party says SIR exercise is a transparent process and neither the party nor the government has any role in filing the applications

title: Inflow of synthetic drugs in Kochi raises concern
content: While suspected ganja and MDMA make up most of the narcotics seized by the authorities, annual data from the police and the Excise show that peddlers have also found a market for other addictive substances in the city and its suburbs

title: Tri-Services Future Warfare Course begins at Manekshaw Centre
content: According to the Ministry of Defence, this edition features an enhanced and expanded curriculum, focusing on specialised subjects and domain-specific developments shaping contemporary and future military operations.

title: Defence Minister approves Miniratna-I status for Yantra India Limited
content: The company’s major product portfolio includes carbon fibre composites; assembly products for medium and large calibre ammunition; armoured vehicles; artillery guns and main battle tanks; glass composites; and aluminium alloys

title: GBA announces penalties for trade licence renewals in Bengaluru
content: Traders will be allowed to renew their trade licences for a period ranging from one to five financial years

title: Rabid stray dog bites five people in Udayamperoor, two in Thripunithura
content: The dog was eventually caught by a team of animal handlers from the Kochi Corporation on January 31, 2026, says local body representatives

title: Grand plans in the making for Idukki hydel project’s  golden jubilee
content: The ‘birthday’ of Kerala’s largest hydroelectric project falls on February 12. The first stage of the project was dedicated to the nation in 1976 by the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi

title: In Rajya Sabha, Opposition flags farm distress, surge in migration, rising human-wildlife conflict
content: BJD’s Sasmit Patra questions the lack of paddy procurement in Odisha, CPI(M)’s John Brittas attacks former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, transferring wildlife into the Concurrent List, handicapping the States

title: Student activists stage protest against shifting of IIIT from Ongole
content: Student JAC leaders express concerns over drinking water crisis and other issues at new campus in Ballipalli village of Kanigiri mandal

title: Clippers, Harden exploring trade, sources say
content: The LA Clippers and James Harden are exploring trades ahead of Thursday's deadline, with the Cavaliers one of the teams expressing interest.

title: Sources: Bucks countering trade offers for Giannis
content: The Bucks have submitted counteroffers to teams aggressively seeking a trade for two-time MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo, sources told ESPN.

title: Seattle's Kubiak 'all-in' on LX amid Raiders buzz
content: Asked about reports that he's expected to become the next head coach of the Raiders, Seahawks OC Klint Kubiak said his sole focus is on the Super Bowl.

title: NFL to reevaluate Rooney Rule: 'More work to do'
content: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday that the league will take a closer a look at the Rooney Rule and all that it encompasses after an offseason hiring cycle that saw only one of 10 head-coaching jobs go to a minority candidate.

title: Maye (shoulder) 'turned a corner,' threw normally
content: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, who injured his right throwing shoulder in the AFC Championship Game, said he took his normal number of throws at practice Monday and that his recovery has "turned a corner" leading into Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.

title: M's get Cards All-Star Donovan in 3-team deal
content: The Mariners acquired infielder/outfielder Brendan Donovan, a first-time All-Star last season, from the Cardinals.

title: 'Go make a play': Peterson hits 2 late 3s in KU win
content: Darryn Peterson was happy to finally finish a game for No. 11 Kansas, and the Jayhawks certainly needed the standout freshman at the end against No. 13 Texas Tech.

title: Six teams leave RSN Main Street to join MLB
content: Six teams officially left their regional sports network, Main Street Sports, and joined Major League Baseball on Monday, essentially shedding their local-media contracts.

title: Three Alberta junior hockey players killed in crash
content: Three Southern Alberta Mustangs junior hockey players -- JJ Wright, Cameron Casorso and Caden Fine -- were killed Monday morning in a vehicle crash while heading to practice.

title: 🏈 NFL mock draft: Projecting the first two rounds
content: Matt Miller goes two rounds deep in his latest mock. Which prospects rose after the Senior Bowl? Which teams need quarterbacks?

title: Super Bowl LX Patriots-Seahawks media day: Top quotes, moments, highlights
content: Before the Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots take the field for Super Bowl LX, media day festivities took place on Monday.

content: Monday is a night for chipping away at the résumé (Kansas, Texas Tech, UNC), with a couple AQs on the line.

title: State of MLB: Has the Dodgers' dominance propelled the NL past the AL?
content: Today is the 150th anniversary of the National League. We take a look at each league going into the 2026 season.

title: Trump Says India Pledged 'Zero-Tariff Barriers' In US Trade Deal: What It Means
content: US President Donald Trump has announced the US-India trade deal, pledging to slash tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent from 25 per cent, bringing an end to months of uncertainty.

title: Trump Seeks $1 Billion In Damages From Harvard University
content: US President Donald Trump said Monday his administration would seek $1 billion in damages from Harvard University after a New York Times report said the college had won some concessions in ongoing settlement negotiations with the government.

title: Air India Re-inspects Fuel Switches On Boeing 787s After Reported Defect

content: Stocks of the Adani Group companies surged on Tuesday in early trade after the announcement of the India-US trade deal, led by Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL), which traded near the upper circuit of 10 per cent.

title: Groom Kills Friend Hours Before Wedding Over Rs 1.5 Lakh Debt, Arrested
content: A groom allegedly killed his friend on the eve of his wedding in Maharashtra's Beed district, fearing he would disrupt the ceremony over an unpaid debt of Rs 1.5 lakh, police said on Tuesday.

title: Mumbai To Get New Mayor On February 11, Nominations From 6th
content: Mumbai will elect a new mayor on February 11, with the nomination process set to begin on February 6. Nominations for the mayoral post can be filed from February 6.

title: OpenAI Unsatisfied With Chips, Looks Beyond Nvidia For Alternatives: Sources
content: OpenAI is unsatisfied with some of Nvidia's latest artificial intelligence chips, and it has sought alternatives since last year, eight sources familiar with the matter said, potentially complicating the relationship

title: 3 Indians Arrested In Canada For Shooting Outside Surrey Home
content: Three Indian men have been arrested in Canada in connection with a firing incident outside a residence in Surrey. The three men have been charged with a firearm offence and sent to police custody till February 5.

title: Maharashtra Minister Pankaja Munde's Helicopter Faces Technical Issue
content: BJP leader and cabinet minister Pankaja Munde's helicopter faced a technical issue right before she was to travel to Maharashtra's Latur on Tuesday.

title: Epstein Denied Being 'Devil', Claimed To Be Lowest Level Sexual Predator
content: Jeffrey Epstein denied he was the "devil" and insisted he was only the lowest level of sexual predator in a video interview included in the latest release of files by US authorities.

title: A Mother's Search 30 Years After Son Was Kidnapped During 1-Child Policy
content: During the one-child era, the trafficking of young boys was fuelled by parents seeking a son to carry on the family line, experts say. Unwanted girls were often abandoned or sold into sex work, forced marriage or labour.

title: Immigration Agents In Minneapolis Ordered To Wear Body Cameras After Shootings
content: Every Homeland Security officer on the ground in Minneapolis, including those from Immigration and Customs Enforcement, will be immediately issued body-worn cameras, Secretary Kristi Noem said

title: Case Filed Against Owner Of Dog That Mauled Techie In Bengaluru
content: The owner of a dog was booked after his pet allegedly mauled a woman during her morning walk here, leaving her with severe facial and neck injuries that required an eight-hour surgery, police said on Tuesday.

title: After West Bengal row, non-veg back on Vande Bharat train
content:
Kamakhya-Howrah Vande sleeper goes non-veg with chicken curry

KOLKATA: Railways introduced chicken curry on Kamakhya-Howrah Vande Bharat sleeper, reversing a veg-only menu that sparked a political storm, reports Ajanta Chakraborty. The curry will vary by direction — Assamese flavours from Kamakhya, Bengali from Howrah. Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced on Sunday the change days after passengers and Trinamool Congress accused BJP-headed Centre of “policing our plates”. The non-veg option is limited to chicken. Fish will not be served. IRCTC said: “Based on passenger feedback..., it was decided that, for the non-vegetarian option, only a chicken dish (50-60 gms boneless and 70 gms gravy) shall be served…”

End of Article
